meanings.definition: A place where wine is sold.
meanings.sent1: I visited the vintry to buy a bottle of red wine for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The vintry down the street has a wide selection of wines from different regions.
meanings.sent3: At the vintry, they were having a sale on sparkling wines, so I bought a few bottles.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere in the vintry was so inviting, it felt like stepping into a cozy wine cellar.
meanings.sent5: The sign outside the vintry was painted with grapes and vines, making it easy to spot.

meanings.sent1: She decided to start her own vintry after years of working in the wine industry.
meanings.sent2: The vintry business was booming, with customers coming in regularly to purchase their favorite wines.
meanings.sent3: The competition between vintry owners was fierce, each trying to offer the best deals to customers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of vintry, reputation is everything - one bad review can make or break a business.
meanings.sent5: His passion for vintry led him to study winemaking and eventually open his own successful shop.

meanings.sent1: The new vintry in town quickly became popular among wine enthusiasts.
meanings.sent2: I always find unique and rare wines at that vintry on the corner.
meanings.sent3: When I walked into the vintry, I was greeted by the aroma of aged wines and oak barrels.
meanings.sent4: The vintry was elegantly decorated with wooden shelves showcasing bottles of wine from around the world.
meanings.sent5: The owner of the vintry was knowledgeable and helped me choose the perfect wine for my dinner party.
